Game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Game.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TemplateEventAdvance, TemplateEventBasic, TemplateStateDriven

    public abstract class Game
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.lang.Runnable
    This is the base class for all subsequent games. It will update and draw everything. It also has methods built in for playing sound clips and music. This class also automatically converts all key, Mouse, Mouse Motion, and Mouse Wheel events into state driven. All subsequent games should be extensions of this.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • InitializeAndLoad

        public abstract void InitializeAndLoad()
        Where items can be Initialized during the construction of the game

      • UnloadContent

        public abstract void UnloadContent()
        Where content once needed by the constructor for making the game, but no longer needed, can be deleted. Also could be used to simply unload any other content not needed.

      • Update

        public abstract void Update()
        Where all objects needing to be updated can be update at the rate of the game speed. Default game speed is 60 Hz or 60 times per second

      • Draw

        Where all images are loaded into the batch
